page.title: 03TOURISM -LOWER WYE VALLEY
page.content: The Lower Wye Valley and St.Briavels Common areas both cater for the many tourists who visit the area throughout the year.The Forestry Commission provide picnic sites and trails on the Gwent side of the River Wye. There are three recognised camp sites,one in Botany Bay,which is used by the Gwent Scout Association throug- hout the year.Another on the Gloucest- ershire side opposite Llandogo at Woodside House is used by the Polish Scout Association.Children from Polish communities throughout Britain use the camp generally in the summer months. Another camp-site at St.Briavels Common Chapel provides a base for Christian campers and caravanners.Many farms and private households in the area provide sites for caravans and Bed and Breakfast accomodation.
